newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: S.Africa's Nzo to brief African ministers on Zaire.
newsitem.headline: S.Africa's Nzo to brief African ministers on Zaire.

text.p: South African Foreign Minister Alfred Nzo said on Thursday he would brief ministers from 12 southern African states on diplomatic efforts to secure peace in Zaire.

Nzo told reporters he would use a ministerial meeting of the Southern African Development Community (SADC) on politics, defence and security in Harare on Friday to discuss the Zairean crisis, in which President Nelson Mandela is playing a key peacekeeping role.
"Naturally, we are also going to talk about Zaire and the peace efforts. I will brief my colleagues on the peace efforts," he said about the one-day SADC meeting.
SADC consists of Angola, Botswana, Lesotho, Malawi, Mauritius, Mozambique, Namibia, Tanzania, South Africa, Swaziland, Zambia and Zimbabwe.
